material.mattext:
Researchers from Dartmouth Medical School conducted a study in 2003 to look at the connection between watching actors smoking in movies and smoking initiation among adolescents. The study randomly selected 6522 U.S. adolescents aged 10 - 14 who had never tried smoking. Of those who subsequently tried smoking for the first time, 38% did so because of exposure to smoking in the movies.

Estimate the proportion of all U.S. adolescents aged 10 - 14 who started smoking because of seeing actors smoke in movies by constructing a 95% confidence interval.
